title: Wtf
comment: Ugly. Doesn't work. Doesbt make sense. Just awful. Nothing like the elegance of desktop org mode.

title: Nice option to sync with org
comment: But is not very pretty.  Wish it were a beautiful material design app that would be a visual pleasure to take notes with....

title: Not in development
comment: Look at orgzly instead, and cross fingers ;-)
Pointless

title: Solves my integration and mobile needs
comment: This is a super useful app for people who live in their Emacs Org Agenda. The only down side is needing Dropbox or a webdav / ssh server of your own to sync. If it would work with third party apps in a manner like KeePass then it would be darn near perfect

title: Dropbox not getting configured
comment: I am trying to use Dropbox, but after Dropbox authentication it takes me back to options page(where you can radio select wabdev, dropbox, ssh, sd card, etc). And, then it I can not go to next page, pressing arrow and trying to slide does nothing.

title: Broken links
comment: Please fix the incredible bug with [[links]] and I will change this to 5 stars. Until then mobileorg is crippled.
super

title: Very useful, simple, intuitive
comment: Great app. However it's service needlessly runs in the background even though sync is turned off (in short on memory on this device).
Still great!

title: Great app
comment: Has some bugs but it's getting better. I'm expecting location based tag filtering in the future for better GTD environment.

title: This app is great
comment: One thing I like about mobileorg is that I can use Android voice dictation to interact with my to do list.

title: Great tool to rganize thoughts and activities for emacs aficionados
comment: Org-mode is a superb emacs-mode to organize notes and plan activities. MobileOrg brings that to android and works great with only two issues: internal links cannot be followed and synchronizing directly with a laptop/desktop mount is problematic, but this is an android problem (MTPs does often not correctly reflect the internal file state to the outside mount-point) and mobileorg cannot do much about that.

title: Agenda and capture
comment: I didn't want it for todos but to view and maybe edit regular outlines of mine. If that's not supported, please say so in the description of the app so we don't waste our time. Couldn't get it to work either.

title: bring org with you
comment: Syncing orgmode to my phone via dropbox finally makes it a viable planner for me. I didn't have much luck setting up a webdav folder, but Dropbox integration is very easy.

title: fabulous app
comment: Thanks a lot for this great app. It did take some efforts for me to get it going (I am new to even org-mode).  But the effort was certainly worth it. I was so happy to see even the calendar integration working nicely. One feature I'd like to have is entry-level encryption that org-crypt provides. That'd make password storage easier. Anyway, thanks again -  I just love the app.

title: Can't be used with my 'Ubuntu One'
comment: I don't know why,this version can't be fit with my Ubuntu One' which was no problem in the past . When i try to log in the Ubuntu One account in my mobile, it shows "log in successful!".but when I go next ,there is nothing listed for selecting to synch.

title: So useful I could not live without it
comment: The negative reviews here blow my mind. While I will admit mobile-org itself is a bit rough to deal with that is hardly the fault of this client.   I use this app every day for capture and calendar and it just works if you follow the instructions.   Thanks for an excellent app.

title: Seriously, what?
comment: Emacs Org-Mode is one of the greatest pieces of software ever designed. It's sleek, it's powerful, it's productive, and it's enough to dispel all rumours that Emacs is too geeky for average people to use.  So logic would follow that the Android app would be *even more* user-friendly and slick, right?  Uh, I couldn't, um, get this thing to work. I'm a long-time Linux and Emacs geek, and this thing just doesn't work and the documentation isn't very useful.  MobileOrg's user interface itself is confusing. Setting up the environment in server side is providing me *no* results so far. I've never needed as much headaches with Emacs packages since, uh, 1998 or so.  The *concept* is nothing less than awesome, though. OrgMode does everything. Having a mobile companion to an app that does everything would be absolutely sweet.  I really hope there will be new versions of this app that don't require an *ungodly hassle* to set up and have an actually great user interface that doesn't confuse me endlessly. But while waiting for that, I think I'll stick to other apps. Shame, really. Great concept, but it's not there yet.
I'd be more than happy to help you set it up if you'll contact me.
Crashes a lot

title: Syncs perfect.
comment: Been using for a few months. Works perfectly so far!

title: I thought I'd be able to edit org files
comment: But instead there's some impenetrable logic involving "captures". Or maybe no logic at all, because that would manifest a similar appearance.

title: Crashes with Dropbox sync
comment: The app crashes as soon as I click login with the Dropbox sync. I'm using Galaxy S3

title: Excellent app for org-mode for emacs users
comment: If you use org-mode for emacs, this app is essential. Latest update improved a lot the visual interface.

title: Wipes previously-captured items
comment: 0.9.5/0.9.6 seem to have automatically wiped all my capture items. Terrible data-loss bug. Do not auto-update this app.

title: Terrific improvement
comment: The new interface is terrific. Got me back to using mobileorg again. Thanks for this awesome app.

title: ubuntuone support is great
comment: must have!

title: Update is beautiful!
comment: Gives much better overview and polished look. Thanks for the update.

title: Ok
comment: It is a good idea but the formatting and displaying of my org files never seem to be ok... and my files are not terribly complex...

title: Not working.
comment: Not working on Samsung Galaxy Tab 7+

title: No longer text based
comment: The main point of org-mode is that it is storing the data in simple text files, which can be synchronized with version control and edited with any text editor. Putting the data into a database invalidates this concept.

title: Login failed: Network error: null
comment: When I tried to sync with dropbox, I got this error. Dropbox app works fine. But still it's great!

title: Must have app
comment: I use it with org-mode, and it's great! Still programming.  I think i will buy donate version later.

title: Over-engineered
comment: Overly complex design and implementation for so little actual functionality. The whole "synchronization" mechanism is over wrought in the extreme.

title: Great app
comment: Much better than iOS version.

title: Amazing progress.
comment: Keep programming! MobileOrg becomes useable and very nice additional for org-mode on desktop.
I am an Emacs user & I love Org~mode but it crashes on my phone! :: samsung moment
So useful

title: Too basic yet
comment: After trying MobileOrg and MobileOrgNG, I'm just using Jota Text Editor for my .org files on Android until apps for org-mode improve.

title: Very powerful app!
comment: A must if you use org-mode!

title: Hard to setup, big
comment: It's quite a huge app for this functionality. I have spent quite a few hours to set it up.

title: Useful app

Its awesome that this exists, it's an essential part of my workflow., The current functionality works great but it need more features.

Great idea, but further development has been badly needed and it has been slow coming.
